meanings.definition: A state of semi-consciousness or fainting.
meanings.sent1: After hitting his head, he fell into a dwam and couldn't remember what happened.
meanings.sent2: The patient was in a dwam after the surgery, slowly regaining awareness.
meanings.sent3: During the boring lecture, he pretended to be in a dwam to avoid being called on.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset put him in a peaceful dwam, lost in the moment.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves crashing on the shore lulled him into a deep dwam.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of dizziness or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The spinning teacup ride made her dwam and giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The loud music and flashing lights caused him to dwam and lose his balance.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once made him dwam and forget what he was doing.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news made her dwam, unable to process the information.
meanings.sent5: The complex math problem made his head dwam with confusion, unable to find a solution.
